sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A pleasant comedie, called Summers last will and testament. Written by Thomas Nash Summer's last will and testament Nash, Thomas, 1567-1601.
[60] p.
By Simon Stafford, for Walter Burre, Imprinted at London : 1600.
Mostly in verse. Signatures: A² B-H⁴ I² (-C3,4). The first leaf is blank. Running title reads: Summers last will and testament. Variant 1: printer's name misspelled "Water". Sheet F is missigned D; first leaf has the "D" erased and "F" stamped in. Variant 2: this correction not made. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======
A pleasant comedie, called Summers last will and testament. Written by Thomas Nash Summer's last will and testament Nash, Thomas, 1567-1601.
[60] p.
By Simon Stafford, for Walter Burre, Imprinted at London : 1600.
Mostly in verse. Signatures: A² B-H⁴ I² (-C3,4). The first leaf is blank. Running title reads: Summers last will and testament. Variant 1: printer's name misspelled "Water". Sheet F is missigned D; first leaf has the "D" erased and "F" stamped in. Variant 2: this correction not made. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
Walter Burre
Simon Stafford
